content: k2 decrease fasten_off use the tail end to sew the wing tip to the body short row 7 k3 w+t short row 8 k2 w+t to make up short row 9 k1 w+t fold the bird in half matching row ends end short row k7sts to end beginning at the beak over sew the row ends together have the body row ends side by side ready to join with mattress seam join seam row 58 decrease k2 decrease all across - 7sts along the head and the body up to the tail stuffing as you go row 59 k7 join the tail halfway along leaving the remainder un-sewn weave in the row ends cut a length of ribbon/ twine about 60cm/ 24inches long and bend in half beak - change to a different here colour of you like thread the bent end through the bottom of the bird - where its legs would be row 60 decrease skpo k3 k2 decrease - 5sts then in through a stitch at the top of the body near the head so that it emerges row 61 decrease skpo k1 k2 decrease - 3sts through to rs - this will be the hanging loop - make a knot just after the loop to row 62 k secure the loop above the knitting then make a knot at the bottom of the bird to row 63 decrease k3 decrease - fasten_off secure the ribbon at the base
